current.description: A templating engine in JavaScript, a light-weight code base and simple syntax. The source file is tiny but the features are growing. Project hosted on GitHub a few basic test in QUnit and more coming as features are built up from Mustache.js. I am also using a primitive version of this templating engine ported to php on this site.
current.title: Lotus Templates

current.description: Heavily inspired by 960.gs with some added responsive-ness and flixible grid (at compile-time). I enjoy working with the 960 system but needed a smaller gutter on some projects - professionally - so with my step into using .LESS in place of plain CSS I created this nice little builder. Project hosted on GitHub and an available demo page
current.title: ManyGrids.LESS

current.description: At work we made the switch from Viddler to Vimeo and I saw an opportunity for a small, well-defined, starter project to get me familiar with F#. I have learned a lot so far and still have a little way to go before it is completely up and working.
current.title: F#.NET OAuth Wrapper

current.description: Styln is focused on the layout of properly marked up html forms, therefore it only affects the form elements' position and layout. Styln only attempts to baseline and enhance some aspects of the form elements. Project hosted on GitHub
current.title: Styln.css

current.description: SLOC - single linnes of code - is a jQuery plugin for textareas that will be used for code editing. Project hosted on GitHub with simple demo.
current.title: SLOC

current.description: Slideshow plugin to replace Flash version provided by Smugmug. Included is a private JavaScript object providing access to the Smugmug API. Check out the code.
current.title: jQuery Smugmug slideshow plugin

current.description: Accessibility enhancement providing a notification to offer the user a chance to extend their session while not leaving the page. Visit the project, hosted on Google Code or just try a demo.
current.title: JavaScript Session Extender

past.description: Photobox is a simple little plugin that drops images into an area with a random rotation and location; as seen on the homepage of the MSU Student Greenhouse Project.
past.title: Photobox, jQuery image plugin

past.description: PHP based View/Controller framework, similar to MVC, for projects with no need of a Model layer. Used on a rewrite of the MSU SGP website in 2010.
past.title: Self Control View Framework

past.description: Livelist was purposefully developed without dependancies such as jQuery or YUI as a learning exercise on a very small project which would only ever have two users. Demo
past.title: LiveList
